Uses of Class
com.sencha.gxt.data.shared.event.StoreEvent

Packages that use StoreEvent
com.sencha.gxt.data.shared.event   
 

Uses of StoreEvent in com.sencha.gxt.data.shared.event
 

Subclasses of StoreEvent in com.sencha.gxt.data.shared.event
 class StoreAddEvent<M>
          Indicates that an element has been added to the Store, and is visible under the current filter settings.
 class StoreClearEvent<M>
          Indicates that the data in the Store has been cleared, and that corresponding views should be cleared as well.
 class StoreDataChangeEvent<M>
          Indicates that the items in the store have been replaced.
 class StoreFilterEvent<M>
          Indicates that the Store has had its filtering properties changed, resulting in changes in what data is visible.
 class StoreRecordChangeEvent<M>
          Indicates that a Record object in the Store has been changed in some way.
 class StoreRemoveEvent<M>
          Indicates that an element that was visible has been removed from the Store.
 class StoreSortEvent<M>
          Indicates that the store sort properties have changed.
 class StoreUpdateEvent<M>
          Indicates that changes to one or more Store.Records have been committed, so the changes have affected the underlying model.
 class TreeStoreRemoveEvent<M>
          Indicates that an element that was visible has been removed from the Store.
